content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
I received a command from the AI to add a path to the 'arcgis' module using the 'export PATH' command, which I executed successfully. The command returned a blank STDOUT and STDERR response.
"""

Latest Development:
"""
[Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "append_to_file", "args": {"filename": "river.txt", "text": "\nI want to explore rivers in South America."}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content='Command append_to_file returned: Text appended successfully.', type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "google", "args": {"query": "river restoration techniques"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content='Command google returned: ["https://www.therrc.co.uk/manual-river-restoration-techniques", "https://www.engr.colostate.edu/~bbledsoe/CIVE413/Manual_of_River_Restoration_Techniques.htm", "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stream_restoration", "https://www.sciencedirect.com/topics/earth-and-planetary-sciences/river-restoration", "http://nwrm.eu/source/manual-river-restoration-techniques", "https://academic.oup.com/bioscience/article/60/3/209/257006", "https://www.gov.uk/flood-and-coastal-erosion-risk-management-research-reports/updating-the-river-restoration-centre-manual-of-restoration-techniques", "https://www.iowadnr.gov/Portals/idnr/uploads/RiverRestoration/toolbox/vegetative-restoration/Practice%202_Vegetative_Restoration_Full_Chapter.pdf"]', type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "list_files", "args": {"directory": "river_data"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content='Command list_files returned: []', type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "execute_shell", "args": {"command_line": "wget https://www.example.com/file.txt"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content="Command execute_shell returned: STDOUT:
b''
STDERR:
b'--2023-06-13 21:54:12--  https://www.example.com/file.txt\nResolving www.example.com (www.example.com)... 93.184.216.34, 2606:2800:220:1:248:1893:25c8:1946\nConnecting to www.example.com (www.example.com)|93.184.216.34|:443... connected.\nHTTP request sent, awaiting response... 404 Not Found\n2023-06-13 21:54:13 ERROR 404: Not Found.\n\n'", type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "execute_shell", "args": {"command_line": "mkdir river_data"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content="Command execute_shell returned: STDOUT:
b''
STDERR:
b'mkdir: cannot create directory \xe2\x80\x98river_data\xe2\x80\x99: File exists\n'", type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "execute_shell", "args": {"command_line": "git clone https://github.com/river_data.git"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content='Command execute_shell returned: STDOUT:
b''
STDERR:
b"Cloning into 'river_data'...\nremote: Not Found\nfatal: repository 'https://github.com/river_data.git/' not found\n"', type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "google", "args": {"query": "river restoration techniques"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content='Command google returned: ["https://www.therrc.co.uk/manual-river-restoration-techniques", "https://www.engr.colostate.edu/~bbledsoe/CIVE413/Manual_of_River_Restoration_Techniques.htm", "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stream_restoration", "https://www.sciencedirect.com/topics/earth-and-planetary-sciences/river-restoration", "http://nwrm.eu/source/manual-river-restoration-techniques", "https://academic.oup.com/bioscience/article/60/3/209/257006", "https://www.gov.uk/flood-and-coastal-erosion-risk-management-research-reports/updating-the-river-restoration-centre-manual-of-restoration-techniques", "https://www.iowadnr.gov/Portals/idnr/uploads/RiverRestoration/toolbox/vegetative-restoration/Practice%202_Vegetative_Restoration_Full_Chapter.pdf"]', type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "browse_website", "args": {"url": "https://www.therrc.co.uk/manual-river-restoration-techniques", "question": "What are the different techniques used for river restoration?"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content="Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: providing information about the River Restoration Centre's Manual of River Restoration Techniques, which aims to help river managers identify potential restoration techniques for use in river restoration and sustainable river management. The manual includes 68 case examples from 39 sites across the UK, and users can search by river name, restoration aim, or use an interactive map. The text also mentions that the RRC has the expertise to provide further advice on techniques, including those not yet included in the manual.

Links: ['Skip to main content (https://www.therrc.co.uk/manual-river-restoration-techniques#main-content)', ' (https://www.therrc.co.uk/)', 'Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/theriverrestorationcentre)', 'Linkedin (http://www.linkedin.com/company/uk-river-restoration-centre-rrc-)', 'Twitter (http://twitter.com/The_RRC)']", type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "get_text_summary", "args": {"url": "https://www.therrc.co.uk/manual-river-restoration-techniques", "question": "What is the summary of the text on the website 'https://www.therrc.co.uk/manual-river-restoration-techniques'?"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content='Command get_text_summary returned:  "Result" : a description of the River Restoration Centre's Manual of River Restoration Techniques, which provides guidance for river managers on potential restoration techniques for sustainable river management. The manual includes 68 case examples from 39 sites across the UK and can be searched by river name, restoration aim, or an interactive map. The RRC also offers further advice on techniques and project planning, delivery, and evaluation. The text includes decision support pages for restoring meanders, improving channel morphology, green bank protection, natural flood management, and creating floodplain wetland features. The manual is available for download as PDFs and is regularly updated.', type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "write_to_file", "args": {"filename": "river_restoration_summary.txt", "text": "A summary of the River Restoration Centre's Manual of River Restoration Techniques, which provides guidance for river managers on potential restoration techniques for sustainable river management. The manual includes 68 case examples from 39 sites across the UK and can be searched by river name, restoration aim, or an interactive map. The RRC also offers further advice on techniques and project planning, delivery, and evaluation. The text includes decision support pages for restoring meanders, improving channel morphology, green bank protection, natural flood management, and creating floodplain wetland features. The manual is available for download as PDFs and is regularly updated."}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content='Command write_to_file returned: File written to successfully.', type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "list_files", "args": {"directory": "."}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content="Command list_files returned: ['atlas.yaml', 'atlas.settings.yaml', 'file_logger.txt', 'atlas.json', 'river.txt', 'options.txt', 'river_restoration_techniques.txt', 'river_restoration_summary.txt', {"query": "How to turn a river into a lake"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content='Command google returned: ["https://earthobservatory.nasa.gov/images/145055/how-glaciers-turn-lakes-turquoise", "https://hookedonwildwaters.com/river-become-lake/", "https://www.kjrh.com/news/local-news/tulsa-and-jenks-city-leaders-incog-and-tribal-leaders-announce-lake-along-arkansas-river-corridor", "https://www.usgs.gov/special-topics/water-science-school/science/rivers-streams-and-creeks", "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chicago_River", "https://www.nps.gov/yell/learn/nature/water.htm", "https://www.npr.org/2022/03/16/1086988193/st-patricks-day-green-chicago-river", "https://www.nps.gov/lake/learn/nature/overview-of-lake-mead.htm"]', type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "browse_website", "args": {"url": "https://www.kjrh.com/news/local-news/tulsa-and-jenks-city-leaders-incog-and-tribal-leaders-announce-lake-along-arkansas-river-corridor", "question": "How was the lake along the Arkansas River corridor created?"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content="Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: Tulsa, Jenks, and the Muscogee Creek National Council have approved an $8.2 million project to create a new lake in the Arkansas River corridor. The $96 million project will include a marina, a trail system, and a new reinforced shoreline to attract tourists and investors to the area. The lake will be from 71st to 101st, where the dam will hold water as deep as 10 feet. The project is dependent on reaching an agreement with the Muscogee Nation to create a Tax Increment Financing District to pay for the infrastructure.

Links: ['\n\n (https://www.kjrh.com/)', '7 weather alerts (https://www.kjrh.com/weather/alerts)', '1 closings/delays (https://www.kjrh.com/weather/school-closings-delays)', ' Watch Now (https://www.kjrh.com/live)', ' Watch Now (https://www.kjrh.com/live)']", type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "write_to_file", "args": {"filename": "lake_creation.txt", "text": "The creation of a lake along the Arkansas River corridor involves an $8.2 million project that will create a new reinforced shoreline and dam to hold water as deep as 10 feet. The project is dependent on reaching an agreement with the Muscogee Nation to create a Tax Increment Financing District to pay for the infrastructure."}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "execute_python_code", "args": {"code": "import turtle\n\ndef draw_river():\n    turtle.speed(0)\n    turtle.penup()\n    turtle.goto(-300, 0)\n    turtle.pendown()\n    turtle.color('blue')\n    turtle.pensize(10)\n    turtle.forward(600)\n    turtle.penup()\n    turtle.goto(-300, 10)\n    turtle.pendown()\n    turtle.color('white')\n    turtle.pensize(1)\n    turtle.forward(600)\n    turtle.penup()\n    turtle.goto(-300, -10)\n    turtle.pendown()\n    turtle.color('white')\n    turtle.pensize(1)\n    turtle.forward(600)\n    turtle.hideturtle()\n\ndraw_river()", "basename": "river_drawing"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content='Command execute_python_code returned: Error: Traceback (most recent call last):

ImportError: libtk8.6.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
', type='action_result'), Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "execute_shell", "args": {"command_line": "apt-get update && apt-get install -y python3-tk"}}}', type='ai_response')]
"""
